title: Active Geomagnetics
caption:
Charged atmosphere—work in bursts, expect longer recoveries.

— Kp 5.3  •  Bz -10.6 nT  •  Schumann 7.70 Hz
snapshot:
Space Weather Snapshot
Magnetics lean punchy today—expect short surges and brief dips. Drivers: southward IMF windows, faster solar wind. Schumann resonance reads on the lively side at times, matching reports of vivid dreams or restlessness for some. Aurora chances look favorable at higher latitudes—dark skies after local midnight tend to help. Recent notable earthquakes were logged; keep news checks brief if you’re prone to stress. Keep a steady rhythm; if you run sensitive, utilize quick breath resets and short movement breaks.
affects:
How it may feel
- Focus/energy: Disruptions—aim for rhythm over intensity.
- Autonomic/HRV: Southward Bz or higher Kp can nudge HRV down in some; paced breathing helps.
- Sleep: Say no to the extra caffeine and sugar today; keep screens softer.
- Clinician note: If pain flares on active days, apply heat, take it easy and ground.
- Comms/GNSS: Tech may be glitchy today. Satellite based services, especially. Sensitivities may increase.
playbook:
Care notes
- 5–10 min paced breathing (e.g., 4:6) or brief HRV biofeedback
- Hydration + electrolytes; short daylight exposure; move easy
- Protect sleep: blue‑light filters and a consistent wind‑down
- If sensitive, quick grounding/outdoor walk; warm pack for nerve flare windows
